00096 Module::Module(const char *fn) {
00097     // FIXME: It's a hack to do this here, but it must be done after the
00098     // target information has been set (so e.g. the vector width is
00099     // known...)
00100     InitLLVMUtil(g->ctx, g->target);
00101 
00102     filename = fn;
00103     errorCount = 0;
00104     symbolTable = new SymbolTable;
00105     module = new llvm::Module(filename ? filename : "<stdin>", *g->ctx);
00106 
00107     module->setTargetTriple(g->target.GetTripleString());
00108 
00109 #ifndef LLVM_2_8
00110     if (g->generateDebuggingSymbols)
00111         diBuilder = new llvm::DIBuilder(*module);
00112     else
00113         diBuilder = NULL;
00114 #endif // LLVM_2_8
00115 
00116 #ifndef LLVM_2_8
00117     // If we're generating debugging symbols, let the DIBuilder know that
00118     // we're starting a new compilation unit.
00119     if (diBuilder != NULL) {
00120         if (filename == NULL) {
00121             // Unfortunately we can't yet call Error() since the global 'm'
00122             // variable hasn't been initialized yet.
00123             fprintf(stderr, "Can't emit debugging information with no "
00124                     "source file on disk.\n");
00125             ++errorCount;
00126             delete diBuilder;
00127             diBuilder = NULL;
00128         }
00129         else {
00130             std::string directory, name;
00131             GetDirectoryAndFileName(g->currentDirectory, filename, &directory,
00132                                     &name);
00133             diBuilder->createCompileUnit(llvm::dwarf::DW_LANG_C99,  /* lang */
00134                                          name,  /* filename */
00135                                          directory, /* directory */
00136                                          "ispc", /* producer */
00137                                          g->opt.level > 0 /* is optimized */,
00138                                          "-g", /* command line args */
00139                                          0 /* run time version */);
00140         }
00141     }
00142 #endif // LLVM_2_8
00143 }

00146 extern FILE *yyin;
00147 extern int yyparse();
00148 typedef struct yy_buffer_state *YY_BUFFER_STATE;
00149 extern void yy_switch_to_buffer(YY_BUFFER_STATE);
00150 extern YY_BUFFER_STATE yy_scan_string(const char *);
00151 extern YY_BUFFER_STATE yy_create_buffer(FILE *, int);
00152 extern void yy_delete_buffer(YY_BUFFER_STATE);
00153 
00154 int
00155 Module::CompileFile() {
00156     // FIXME: it'd be nice to do this in the Module constructor, but this
00157     // function ends up calling into routines that expect the global
00158     // variable 'm' to be initialized and available (which it isn't until
00159     // the Module constructor returns...)
00160     DefineStdlib(symbolTable, g->ctx, module, g->includeStdlib);
00161 
00162     bool runPreprocessor = g->runCPP;
00163 
00164     if (runPreprocessor) {
00165         if (filename != NULL) {
00166             // Try to open the file first, since otherwise we crash in the
00167             // preprocessor if the file doesn't exist.
00168             FILE *f = fopen(filename, "r");
00169             if (!f) {
00170                 perror(filename);
00171                 return 1;
00172             }
00173             fclose(f);
00174         }
00175 
00176         std::string buffer;
00177         llvm::raw_string_ostream os(buffer);
00178         execPreprocessor((filename != NULL) ? filename : "-", &os);
00179         YY_BUFFER_STATE strbuf = yy_scan_string(os.str().c_str());
00180         yyparse();
00181         yy_delete_buffer(strbuf);
00182     }
00183     else {
00184         // No preprocessor, just open up the file if it's not stdin..
00185         FILE* f = NULL;
00186         if (filename == NULL) 
00187             f = stdin;
00188         else {
00189             f = fopen(filename, "r");
00190             if (f == NULL) {
00191                 perror(filename);
00192                 return 1;
00193             }
00194         }
00195         yyin = f;
00196         yy_switch_to_buffer(yy_create_buffer(yyin, 4096));
00197         yyparse();
00198         fclose(f);
00199     }
00200 
00201     if (errorCount == 0)
00202         Optimize(module, g->opt.level);
00203 
00204     return errorCount;
00205 }
00206 
00207 
00208 /** Given an arbitrary type, see if it or any of the types contained in it
00209     are varying.  Returns true if so, false otherwise. 
00210 */
00211 static bool
00212 lRecursiveCheckVarying(const Type *t) {
00213     t = t->GetBaseType();
00214     if (t->IsVaryingType()) return true;
00215 
00216     const StructType *st = dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(t);
00217     if (st) {
00218         for (int i = 0; i < st->GetElementCount(); ++i)
00219             if (lRecursiveCheckVarying(st->GetElementType(i)))
00220                 return true;
00221     }
00222     return false;
00223 }
00224 
00225 
00226 /** Given a Symbol representing a function parameter, see if it or any
00227     contained types are varying.  If so, issue an error.  (This function
00228     should only be called for parameters to 'export'ed functions, where
00229     varying parameters is illegal.
00230  */
00231 static void
00232 lCheckForVaryingParameter(Symbol *sym) {
00233     if (lRecursiveCheckVarying(sym->type)) {
00234         const Type *t = sym->type->GetBaseType();
00235         if (dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(t))
00236             Error(sym->pos, "Struct parameter \"%s\" with varying member(s) is illegal "
00237                   "in an exported function.",
00238                   sym->name.c_str());
00239         else
00240             Error(sym->pos, "Varying parameter \"%s\" is illegal in an exported function.",
00241                   sym->name.c_str());
00242     }
00243 }
00244 
00245 
00246 /** Given a function type, loop through the function parameters and see if
00247     any are StructTypes.  If so, issue an error (this seems to be broken
00248     currently).
00249 
00250     @todo Fix passing structs from C/C++ to ispc functions.
00251  */
00252 static void
00253 lCheckForStructParameters(const FunctionType *ftype, SourcePos pos) {
00254     const std::vector<const Type *> &argTypes = ftype->GetArgumentTypes();
00255     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < argTypes.size(); ++i) {
00256         const Type *type = argTypes[i];
00257         if (dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(type) != NULL) {
00258             Error(pos, "Passing structs to/from application functions is currently broken. "
00259                   "Use a reference or const reference instead for now.");
00260             return;
00261         }
00262     }
00263 }
00264 
00265 
00266 /** We've got a declaration for a function to process.  This function does
00267     all the work of creating the corresponding llvm::Function instance,
00268     adding the symbol for the function to the symbol table and doing
00269     various sanity checks.  This function returns true upon success and
00270     false if any errors were encountered.
00271  */
00272 static bool
00273 lInitFunSymDecl(DeclSpecs *ds, Declarator *decl) {
00274     // Make sure that we've got what we expect here
00275     Symbol *funSym = decl->sym;
00276     assert(decl->isFunction);
00277     assert(decl->arraySize.size() == 0);
00278 
00279     // So far, so good.  Go ahead and set the type of the function symbol
00280     funSym->type = decl->GetType(ds);
00281 
00282     // If a global variable with the same name has already been declared
00283     // issue an error.
00284     if (m->symbolTable->LookupVariable(funSym->name.c_str()) != NULL) {
00285         Error(decl->pos, "Function \"%s\" shadows previously-declared global variable. "
00286               "Ignoring this definition.",
00287               funSym->name.c_str());
00288         return false;
00289     }
00290 
00291     if (ds->storageClass == SC_EXTERN_C) {
00292         // Make sure the user hasn't supplied both an 'extern "C"' and a
00293         // 'task' qualifier with the function
00294         if (ds->typeQualifier & TYPEQUAL_TASK) {
00295             Error(funSym->pos, "\"task\" qualifier is illegal with C-linkage extern "
00296                   "function \"%s\".  Ignoring this function.", funSym->name.c_str());
00297             return false;
00298         }
00299         std::vector<Symbol *> *funcs;
00300         funcs = m->symbolTable->LookupFunction(decl->sym->name.c_str());
00301         if (funcs != NULL) {
00302             if (funcs->size() > 1) {
00303                 // Multiple functions with this name have already been declared; 
00304                 // can't overload here
00305                 Error(funSym->pos, "Can't overload extern \"C\" function \"%s\"; "
00306                       "%d functions with the same name have already been declared.",
00307                       funSym->name.c_str(), (int)funcs->size());
00308                 return false;
00309             }
00310 
00311             // One function with the same name has been declared; see if it
00312             // has the same type as this one, in which case it's ok.
00313             if (Type::Equal((*funcs)[0]->type, funSym->type))
00314                 return true;
00315             else {
00316                 Error(funSym->pos, "Can't overload extern \"C\" function \"%s\".",
00317                       funSym->name.c_str());
00318                 return false;
00319             }
00320         }
00321     }
00322 
00323     // We should have gotten a FunctionType back from the GetType() call above.
00324     const FunctionType *functionType = 
00325         dynamic_cast<const FunctionType *>(funSym->type);
00326     assert(functionType != NULL);
00327 
00328     // Get the LLVM FunctionType
00329     bool includeMask = (ds->storageClass != SC_EXTERN_C);
00330     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::FunctionType *llvmFunctionType = 
00331         functionType->LLVMFunctionType(g->ctx, includeMask);
00332     if (llvmFunctionType == NULL)
00333         return false;
00334 
00335     // And create the llvm::Function
00336     llvm::GlobalValue::LinkageTypes linkage = ds->storageClass == SC_STATIC ?
00337         llvm::GlobalValue::InternalLinkage : llvm::GlobalValue::ExternalLinkage;
00338     std::string functionName = ((ds->storageClass == SC_EXTERN_C) ?
00339                                 funSym->name : funSym->MangledName());
00340     llvm::Function *function = 
00341         llvm::Function::Create(llvmFunctionType, linkage, functionName.c_str(), m->module);
00342 
00343     // Set function attributes: we never throw exceptions, and want to
00344     // inline everything we can
00345     function->setDoesNotThrow(true);
00346     if (!(ds->storageClass == SC_EXTERN_C) && !g->generateDebuggingSymbols &&
00347         (ds->typeQualifier & TYPEQUAL_INLINE))
00348         function->addFnAttr(llvm::Attribute::AlwaysInline);
00349     if (functionType->isTask)
00350         // This also applies transitively to members I think? 
00351         function->setDoesNotAlias(1, true);
00352 
00353     // Make sure that the return type isn't 'varying' if the function is
00354     // 'export'ed.
00355     if (ds->storageClass == SC_EXPORT && lRecursiveCheckVarying(functionType->GetReturnType()))
00356         Error(decl->pos, "Illegal to return a \"varying\" type from exported function \"%s\"",
00357               funSym->name.c_str());
00358 
00359     if (functionType->isTask && (functionType->GetReturnType() != AtomicType::Void))
00360         Error(funSym->pos, "Task-qualified functions must have void return type.");
00361 
00362     if (functionType->isExported || functionType->isExternC)
00363         lCheckForStructParameters(functionType, funSym->pos);
00364 
00365     // Loop over all of the arguments; process default values if present
00366     // and do other checks and parameter attribute setting.
00367     bool seenDefaultArg = false;
00368     std::vector<ConstExpr *> argDefaults;
00369     int nArgs = decl->functionArgs ? decl->functionArgs->size() : 0;
00370     for (int i = 0; i < nArgs; ++i) {
00371         Declaration *pdecl = (*decl->functionArgs)[i];
00372         assert(pdecl->declarators.size() == 1);
00373         Symbol *sym = pdecl->declarators[0]->sym;
00374 
00375         // If the function is exported, make sure that the parameter
00376         // doesn't have any varying stuff going on in it.
00377         if (ds->storageClass == SC_EXPORT)
00378             lCheckForVaryingParameter(sym);
00379 
00380         // ISPC assumes that all memory passed in is aligned to the native
00381         // width and that no pointers alias.  (It should be possible to
00382         // specify when this is not the case, but this should be the
00383         // default.)  Set parameter attributes accordingly.
00384         if (!functionType->isTask && dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(sym->type) != NULL) {
00385             // NOTE: LLVM indexes function parameters starting from 1.
00386             // This is unintuitive.
00387             function->setDoesNotAlias(i+1, true);
00388             int align = 4 * RoundUpPow2(g->target.nativeVectorWidth);
00389             function->addAttribute(i+1, llvm::Attribute::constructAlignmentFromInt(align));
00390         }
00391 
00392         if (m->symbolTable->LookupFunction(sym->name.c_str()) != NULL)
00393             Warning(sym->pos, "Function parameter \"%s\" shadows a function "
00394                     "declared in global scope.", sym->name.c_str());
00395         
00396         // See if a default argument value was provided with the parameter
00397         Expr *defaultValue = pdecl->declarators[0]->initExpr;
00398         if (defaultValue != NULL) {
00399             // If we have one, make sure it's a compile-time constant
00400             seenDefaultArg = true;
00401             defaultValue = defaultValue->TypeCheck();
00402             defaultValue = defaultValue->Optimize();
00403             defaultValue = dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(defaultValue);
00404             if (!defaultValue) {
00405                 Error(sym->pos, "Default value for parameter \"%s\" must be "
00406                       "a compile-time constant.", sym->name.c_str());
00407                 return false;
00408             }
00409         }
00410         else if (seenDefaultArg) {
00411             // Once one parameter has provided a default value, then all of
00412             // the following ones must have them as well.
00413             Error(sym->pos, "Parameter \"%s\" is missing default: all parameters after "
00414                   "the first parameter with a default value must have default values "
00415                   "as well.", sym->name.c_str());
00416         }
00417 
00418         // Add the default value to argDefaults.  Note that we make this
00419         // call for all parameters, even those where no default value was
00420         // provided.  In that case, a NULL value is stored here.  This
00421         // approach means that we can always just look at the i'th entry of
00422         // argDefaults to find the default value for the i'th parameter.
00423         argDefaults.push_back(dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(defaultValue));
00424     }
00425 
00426     // And only now can we set the default values in the FunctionType
00427     functionType->SetArgumentDefaults(argDefaults);
00428 
00429     // If llvm gave us back a Function * with a different name than the one
00430     // we asked for, then there's already a function with that same
00431     // (mangled) name in the llvm::Module.  In that case, erase the one we
00432     // tried to add and just work with the one it already had.
00433     if (function->getName() != functionName) {
00434         function->eraseFromParent();
00435         function = m->module->getFunction(functionName);
00436     }
00437     funSym->function = function;
00438 
00439     // But if that function has a definition, we don't want to redefine it.
00440     if (!function->empty()) {
00441         Warning(funSym->pos, "Ignoring redefinition of function \"%s\".", 
00442                 funSym->name.c_str());
00443         return false;
00444     }
00445 
00446     // Finally, we know all is good and we can add the function to the
00447     // symbol table
00448     bool ok = m->symbolTable->AddFunction(funSym);
00449     assert(ok);
00450     return true;
00451 }
00452 
00453 
00454 void
00455 Module::AddGlobal(DeclSpecs *ds, Declarator *decl) {
00456     // This function is called for a number of cases: function
00457     // declarations, typedefs, and global variables declarations /
00458     // definitions.  Figure out what we've got and take care of it.
00459 
00460     if (decl->isFunction) {
00461         // function declaration
00462         const Type *t = decl->GetType(ds);
00463         const FunctionType *ft = dynamic_cast<const FunctionType *>(t);
00464         assert(ft != NULL);
00465         if (m->symbolTable->LookupFunction(decl->sym->name.c_str(), ft) != NULL)
00466             // Ignore redeclaration of a function with the same name and type
00467             return;
00468         // Otherwise do all of the llvm Module and SymbolTable work..
00469         lInitFunSymDecl(ds, decl);
00470     }
00471     else if (ds->storageClass == SC_TYPEDEF) {
00472         // Typedefs are easy; just add the mapping between the given name
00473         // and the given type.
00474         m->symbolTable->AddType(decl->sym->name.c_str(), decl->sym->type,
00475                                 decl->sym->pos);
00476     }
00477     else {
00478         // global variable
00479         if (m->symbolTable->LookupFunction(decl->sym->name.c_str()) != NULL) {
00480             Error(decl->pos, "Global variable \"%s\" shadows previously-declared function.",
00481                   decl->sym->name.c_str());
00482             return;
00483         }
00484 
00485         // These may be NULL due to errors in parsing; just gracefully
00486         // return here if so.
00487         if (!decl->sym || !decl->sym->type) {
00488             // But if these are NULL and there haven't been any previous
00489             // errors, something surprising is going on
00490             assert(errorCount > 0);
00491             return;
00492         }
00493 
00494         if (ds->storageClass == SC_EXTERN_C) {
00495             Error(decl->pos, "extern \"C\" qualifier can only be used for functions.");
00496             return;
00497         }
00498 
00499         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *llvmType = decl->sym->type->LLVMType(g->ctx);
00500         llvm::GlobalValue::LinkageTypes linkage =
00501             (ds->storageClass == SC_STATIC) ? llvm::GlobalValue::InternalLinkage :
00502                                               llvm::GlobalValue::ExternalLinkage;
00503 
00504         // See if we have an initializer expression for the global.  If so,
00505         // make sure it's a compile-time constant!
00506         llvm::Constant *llvmInitializer = NULL;
00507         if (ds->storageClass == SC_EXTERN || ds->storageClass == SC_EXTERN_C) {
00508             externGlobals.push_back(decl->sym);
00509             if (decl->initExpr != NULL)
00510                 Error(decl->pos, "Initializer can't be provided with \"extern\" "
00511                       "global variable \"%s\".", decl->sym->name.c_str());
00512         }
00513         else {
00514             if (decl->initExpr != NULL) {
00515                 decl->initExpr = decl->initExpr->TypeCheck();
00516                 if (decl->initExpr != NULL) {
00517                     // We need to make sure the initializer expression is
00518                     // the same type as the global.  (But not if it's an
00519                     // ExprList; they don't have types per se / can't type
00520                     // convert themselves anyway.)
00521                     if (dynamic_cast<ExprList *>(decl->initExpr) == NULL)
00522                         decl->initExpr = 
00523                             decl->initExpr->TypeConv(decl->sym->type, "initializer");
00524 
00525                     if (decl->initExpr != NULL) {
00526                         decl->initExpr = decl->initExpr->Optimize();
00527                         // Fingers crossed, now let's see if we've got a
00528                         // constant value..
00529                         llvmInitializer = decl->initExpr->GetConstant(decl->sym->type);
00530 
00531                         if (llvmInitializer != NULL) {
00532                             if (decl->sym->type->IsConstType())
00533                                 // Try to get a ConstExpr associated with
00534                                 // the symbol.  This dynamic_cast can
00535                                 // validly fail, for example for types like
00536                                 // StructTypes where a ConstExpr can't
00537                                 // represent their values.
00538                                 decl->sym->constValue = 
00539                                     dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(decl->initExpr);
00540                         }
00541                         else
00542                             Error(decl->pos, "Initializer for global variable \"%s\" "
00543                                   "must be a constant.", decl->sym->name.c_str());
00544                     }
00545                 }
00546             }
00547 
00548             // If no initializer was provided or if we couldn't get a value
00549             // above, initialize it with zeros..
00550             if (llvmInitializer == NULL)
00551                 llvmInitializer = llvm::Constant::getNullValue(llvmType);
00552         }
00553 
00554         bool isConst = (ds->typeQualifier & TYPEQUAL_CONST) != 0;
00555         decl->sym->storagePtr = new llvm::GlobalVariable(*module, llvmType, isConst, 
00556                                                          linkage, llvmInitializer, 
00557                                                          decl->sym->name.c_str());
00558         m->symbolTable->AddVariable(decl->sym);
00559 
00560 #ifndef LLVM_2_8
00561         if (diBuilder && (ds->storageClass != SC_EXTERN)) {
00562             llvm::DIFile file = decl->pos.GetDIFile();
00563             diBuilder->createGlobalVariable(decl->sym->name, 
00564                                             file,
00565                                             decl->pos.first_line,
00566                                             decl->sym->type->GetDIType(file),
00567                                             (ds->storageClass == SC_STATIC),
00568                                             decl->sym->storagePtr);
00569         }
00570 #endif // LLVM_2_8
00571     }
00572 }
00573 
00574 
00575 /** Parameters for tasks are stored in a big structure; this utility
00576     function emits code to copy those values out of the task structure into
00577     local stack-allocated variables.  (Which we expect that LLVM's
00578     'mem2reg' pass will in turn promote to SSA registers..
00579  */
00580 static void
00581 lCopyInTaskParameter(int i, llvm::Value *structArgPtr, Declarator *decl, 
00582                      FunctionEmitContext *ctx) {
00583     // We expect the argument structure to come in as a poitner to a
00584     // structure.  Confirm and figure out its type here.
00585     const llvm::Type *structArgType = structArgPtr->getType();
00586     assert(llvm::isa<llvm::PointerType>(structArgType));
00587     const llvm::PointerType *pt = llvm::dyn_cast<const llvm::PointerType>(structArgType);
00588     assert(llvm::isa<llvm::StructType>(pt->getElementType()));
00589     const llvm::StructType *argStructType = 
00590         llvm::dyn_cast<const llvm::StructType>(pt->getElementType());
00591 
00592     // Get the type of the argument we're copying in and its Symbol pointer
00593     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *argType = argStructType->getElementType(i);
00594     Declaration *pdecl = (*decl->functionArgs)[i];
00595     assert(pdecl->declarators.size() == 1);
00596     Symbol *sym = pdecl->declarators[0]->sym;
00597 
00598     // allocate space to copy the parameter in to
00599     sym->storagePtr = ctx->AllocaInst(argType, sym->name.c_str());
00600 
00601     // get a pointer to the value in the struct
00602     llvm::Value *ptr = ctx->GetElementPtrInst(structArgPtr, 0, i, sym->name.c_str());
00603 
00604     // and copy the value from the struct and into the local alloca'ed
00605     // memory
00606     llvm::Value *ptrval = ctx->LoadInst(ptr, NULL, sym->name.c_str());
00607     ctx->StoreInst(ptrval, sym->storagePtr);
00608     ctx->EmitFunctionParameterDebugInfo(sym);
00609 }
00610 
00611 
00612 /** Given the statements implementing a function, emit the code that
00613     implements the function.  Most of the work do be done here just
00614     involves wiring up the function parameter values to be available in the
00615     function body code.
00616  */
00617 static void 
00618 lEmitFunctionCode(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, llvm::Function *function, 
00619                   const FunctionType *ft, Symbol *funSym,
00620                   Declarator *decl, Stmt *code) {
00621 #if 0
00622     llvm::BasicBlock *entryBBlock = ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock();
00623 #endif
00624     if (ft->isTask == true) {
00625         // For tasks, we there should always be three parmeters: the
00626         // pointer to the structure that holds all of the arguments, the
00627         // thread index, and the thread count variables.
00628         llvm::Function::arg_iterator argIter = function->arg_begin();
00629         llvm::Value *structParamPtr = argIter++;
00630         llvm::Value *threadIndex = argIter++;
00631         llvm::Value *threadCount = argIter++;
00632 
00633         // Copy the function parameter values from the structure into local
00634         // storage
00635         if (decl->functionArgs)
00636             for (unsigned int i = 0; i < decl->functionArgs->size(); ++i)
00637                 lCopyInTaskParameter(i, structParamPtr, decl, ctx);
00638 
00639         // Copy in the mask as well.
00640         int nArgs = decl->functionArgs ? decl->functionArgs->size() : 0;
00641         // The mask is the last parameter in the argument structure
00642         llvm::Value *ptr = ctx->GetElementPtrInst(structParamPtr, 0, nArgs,
00643                                                   "task_struct_mask");
00644         llvm::Value *ptrval = ctx->LoadInst(ptr, NULL, "mask");
00645         ctx->SetEntryMask(ptrval);
00646 
00647         // Copy threadIndex and threadCount into stack-allocated storage so
00648         // that their symbols point to something reasonable.
00649         Symbol *threadIndexSym = m->symbolTable->LookupVariable("threadIndex");
00650         assert(threadIndexSym);
00651         threadIndexSym->storagePtr = ctx->AllocaInst(LLVMTypes::Int32Type, "threadIndex");
00652         ctx->StoreInst(threadIndex, threadIndexSym->storagePtr);
00653 
00654         Symbol *threadCountSym = m->symbolTable->LookupVariable("threadCount");
00655         assert(threadCountSym);
00656         threadCountSym->storagePtr = ctx->AllocaInst(LLVMTypes::Int32Type, "threadCount");
00657         ctx->StoreInst(threadCount, threadCountSym->storagePtr);
00658 
00659 #ifdef ISPC_IS_WINDOWS
00660         // On Windows, we dynamically-allocate space for the task arguments
00661         // (see FunctionEmitContext::LaunchInst().)  Here is where we emit
00662         // the code to free that memory, now that we've copied the
00663         // parameter values out of the structure.
00664         ctx->EmitFree(structParamPtr);
00665 #endif // ISPC_IS_WINDOWS
00666     }
00667     else {
00668         // Regular, non-task function
00669         llvm::Function::arg_iterator argIter = function->arg_begin(); 
00670         if (decl->functionArgs) {
00671             for (unsigned int i = 0; i < decl->functionArgs->size(); ++i, ++argIter) {
00672                 Declaration *pdecl = (*decl->functionArgs)[i];
00673                 assert(pdecl->declarators.size() == 1);
00674                 Symbol *sym = pdecl->declarators[0]->sym;
00675                 argIter->setName(sym->name.c_str());
00676 
00677                 // Allocate stack storage for the parameter and emit code
00678                 // to store the its value there.
00679                 sym->storagePtr = ctx->AllocaInst(argIter->getType(), sym->name.c_str());
00680                 ctx->StoreInst(argIter, sym->storagePtr);
00681                 ctx->EmitFunctionParameterDebugInfo(sym);
00682             }
00683         }
00684 
00685         // If the number of actual function arguments is equal to the
00686         // number of declared arguments in decl->functionArgs, then we
00687         // don't have a mask parameter, so set it to be all on.  This
00688         // happens for exmaple with 'export'ed functions that the app
00689         // calls.
00690         if (argIter == function->arg_end())
00691             ctx->SetEntryMask(LLVMMaskAllOn);
00692         else {
00693             // Otherwise use the mask to set the entry mask value
00694             argIter->setName("__mask");
00695             assert(argIter->getType() == LLVMTypes::MaskType);
00696             ctx->SetEntryMask(argIter);
00697             assert(++argIter == function->arg_end());
00698         }
00699     }
00700 
00701     // Finally, we can generate code for the function
00702     if (code != NULL) {
00703         bool checkMask = (ft->isTask == true) || 
00704             (function->hasFnAttr(llvm::Attribute::AlwaysInline) == false);
00705         if (checkMask) {
00706             bool allTrue[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
00707             for (int i = 0; i < g->target.vectorWidth; ++i)
00708                 allTrue[i] = true;
00709             Expr *trueExpr = new ConstExpr(AtomicType::VaryingBool, allTrue, 
00710                                            code->pos);
00711             code = new IfStmt(trueExpr, code, NULL, true, code->pos);
00712         }
00713 
00714         ctx->SetDebugPos(code->pos);
00715         ctx->AddInstrumentationPoint("function entry");
00716         code->EmitCode(ctx);
00717     }
00718 
00719     if (ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock()) {
00720         // FIXME: We'd like to issue a warning if we've reached the end of
00721         // the function without a return statement (for non-void
00722         // functions).  But the test below isn't right, since we can have
00723         // (with 'x' a varying test) "if (x) return a; else return b;", in
00724         // which case we have a valid basic block but its unreachable so ok
00725         // to not have return statement.
00726 #if 0
00727         // If the bblock has no predecessors, then it doesn't matter if it
00728         // doesn't have a return; it'll never be reached.  If it does,
00729         // issue a warning.  Also need to warn if it's the entry block for
00730         // the function (in which case it will not have predeccesors but is
00731         // still reachable.)
00732         if (ft->GetReturnType() != AtomicType::Void &&
00733             (pred_begin(ec.bblock) != pred_end(ec.bblock) || (ec.bblock == entryBBlock)))
00734             Warning(funSym->pos, "Missing return statement in function returning \"%s\".",
00735                     ft->rType->GetString().c_str());
00736 #endif
00737 
00738         // FIXME: would like to set the context's current position to
00739         // e.g. the end of the function code
00740 
00741         // if bblock is non-NULL, it hasn't been terminated by e.g. a
00742         // return instruction.  Need to add a return instruction.
00743         ctx->ReturnInst();
00744     }
00745 }
00746 
00747 
00748 void
00749 Module::AddFunction(DeclSpecs *ds, Declarator *decl, Stmt *code) {
00750     if (code) {
00751         code = code->TypeCheck();
00752         if (code)
00753             code = code->Optimize();
00754     }
00755 
00756     if (g->debugPrint) {
00757         printf("Add Function\n");
00758         ds->Print();
00759         printf("\n");
00760         decl->Print();
00761         printf("\n");
00762         code->Print(0);
00763         printf("\n\n\n");
00764     }
00765 
00766     // Get the symbol for the function from the symbol table.  (It should
00767     // already have been added to the symbol table by AddGlobal() by the
00768     // time we get here.)
00769     const FunctionType *functionType =
00770         dynamic_cast<const FunctionType *>(decl->GetType(ds));
00771     assert(functionType != NULL);
00772     Symbol *funSym = symbolTable->LookupFunction(decl->sym->name.c_str(), 
00773                                                  functionType);
00774     assert(funSym != NULL);
00775     funSym->pos = decl->pos;
00776 
00777     llvm::Function *function = funSym->function;
00778     assert(function != NULL);
00779 
00780     // Figure out a reasonable source file position for the start of the
00781     // function body.  If possible, get the position of the first actual
00782     // non-StmtList statment...
00783     SourcePos firstStmtPos = funSym->pos;
00784     if (code) {
00785         StmtList *sl = dynamic_cast<StmtList *>(code);
00786         if (sl && sl->GetStatements().size() > 0 && 
00787             sl->GetStatements()[0] != NULL)
00788             firstStmtPos = sl->GetStatements()[0]->pos;
00789         else
00790             firstStmtPos = code->pos;
00791     }
00792 
00793     // And we can now go ahead and emit the code 
00794     {
00795         FunctionEmitContext ec(functionType->GetReturnType(), function, funSym,
00796                                firstStmtPos);
00797         lEmitFunctionCode(&ec, function, functionType, funSym, decl, code);
00798     }
00799 
00800     if (errorCount == 0) {
00801         if (llvm::verifyFunction(*function, llvm::ReturnStatusAction) == true) {
00802             if (g->debugPrint) {
00803                 llvm::PassManager ppm;
00804                 ppm.add(llvm::createPrintModulePass(&llvm::outs()));
00805                 ppm.run(*module);
00806             }
00807             FATAL("Function verificication failed");
00808         }
00809 
00810         // If the function is 'export'-qualified, emit a second version of
00811         // it without a mask parameter and without name mangling so that
00812         // the application can call it
00813         if (ds->storageClass == SC_EXPORT) {
00814             if (!functionType->isTask) {
00815                 LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::FunctionType *ftype = 
00816                     functionType->LLVMFunctionType(g->ctx);
00817                 llvm::GlobalValue::LinkageTypes linkage = llvm::GlobalValue::ExternalLinkage;
00818                 llvm::Function *appFunction = 
00819                     llvm::Function::Create(ftype, linkage, funSym->name.c_str(), module);
00820                 appFunction->setDoesNotThrow(true);
00821 
00822                 if (appFunction->getName() != funSym->name) {
00823                     // this was a redefinition for which we already emitted an
00824                     // error, so don't worry about this one...
00825                     appFunction->eraseFromParent();
00826                 }
00827                 else {
00828                     // And emit the code again
00829                     FunctionEmitContext ec(functionType->GetReturnType(), appFunction, funSym,
00830                                            firstStmtPos);
00831                     lEmitFunctionCode(&ec, appFunction, functionType, funSym, decl, code);
00832                     if (errorCount == 0) {
00833                         if (llvm::verifyFunction(*appFunction, 
00834                                                  llvm::ReturnStatusAction) == true) {
00835                             if (g->debugPrint) {
00836                                 llvm::PassManager ppm;
00837                                 ppm.add(llvm::createPrintModulePass(&llvm::outs()));
00838                                 ppm.run(*module);
00839                             }
00840                             FATAL("Function verificication failed");
00841                         }
00842                     }
00843                 }
00844             }
00845         }
00846     }
00847 }
00848 
00849 
00850 bool
00851 Module::WriteOutput(OutputType outputType, const char *outFileName) {
00852 #if defined(LLVM_3_0) || defined(LLVM_3_0svn)
00853     if (diBuilder != NULL && outputType != Header)
00854         diBuilder->finalize();
00855 #endif // LLVM_3_0
00856 
00857     // First, issue a warning if the output file suffix and the type of
00858     // file being created seem to mismatch.  This can help catch missing
00859     // command-line arguments specifying the output file type.
00860     const char *suffix = strrchr(outFileName, '.');
00861     if (suffix != NULL) {
00862         ++suffix;
00863         const char *fileType = NULL;
00864         switch (outputType) {
00865         case Asm:
00866             if (strcasecmp(suffix, "s"))
00867                 fileType = "assembly";
00868             break;
00869         case Bitcode:
00870             if (strcasecmp(suffix, "bc"))
00871                 fileType = "LLVM bitcode";
00872             break;
00873         case Object:
00874             if (strcasecmp(suffix, "o") && strcasecmp(suffix, "obj"))
00875                 fileType = "object";
00876             break;
00877         case Header:
00878             if (strcasecmp(suffix, "h") && strcasecmp(suffix, "hh") &&
00879                 strcasecmp(suffix, "hpp"))
00880                 fileType = "header";
00881             break;
00882         }
00883         if (fileType != NULL)
00884             fprintf(stderr, "Warning: emitting %s file, but filename \"%s\" "
00885                     "has suffix \"%s\"?\n", fileType, outFileName, suffix);
00886     }
00887 
00888     if (outputType == Header)
00889         return writeHeader(outFileName);
00890     else {
00891         if (outputType == Bitcode) {
00892             // Get a file descriptor corresponding to where we want the output
00893             // to go.  If we open it, it'll be closed by the
00894             // llvm::raw_fd_ostream destructor.
00895             int fd;
00896             if (!strcmp(outFileName, "-"))
00897                 fd = 1; // stdout
00898             else {
00899                 int flags = O_CREAT|O_WRONLY|O_TRUNC;
00900 #ifdef ISPC_IS_WINDOWS
00901                 flags |= O_BINARY;
00902                 fd = _open(outFileName, flags, 0644);
00903 #else
00904                 fd = open(outFileName, flags, 0644);
00905 #endif // ISPC_IS_WINDOWS
00906                 if (fd == -1) {
00907                     perror(outFileName);
00908                     return false;
00909                 }
00910             }
00911 
00912             llvm::raw_fd_ostream fos(fd, (fd != 1), false);
00913             llvm::WriteBitcodeToFile(module, fos);
00914             return true;
00915         }
00916         else {
00917 #ifdef LLVM_2_8
00918             fprintf(stderr, "Direct object file emission not supported in this build.\n");
00919             return false;
00920 #else
00921             return writeObjectFileOrAssembly(outputType, outFileName);
00922 #endif // LLVM_2_8
00923         }
00924     }
00925 }
00926 
00927 
00928 bool
00929 Module::writeObjectFileOrAssembly(OutputType outputType, const char *outFileName) {
00930     llvm::TargetMachine *targetMachine = g->target.GetTargetMachine();
00931 
00932     // Figure out if we're generating object file or assembly output, and
00933     // set binary output for object files
00934     llvm::TargetMachine::CodeGenFileType fileType = (outputType == Object) ? 
00935         llvm::TargetMachine::CGFT_ObjectFile : llvm::TargetMachine::CGFT_AssemblyFile;
00936     bool binary = (fileType == llvm::TargetMachine::CGFT_ObjectFile);
00937     unsigned int flags = binary ? llvm::raw_fd_ostream::F_Binary : 0;
00938 
00939     std::string error;
00940     llvm::tool_output_file *of = new llvm::tool_output_file(outFileName, error, flags);
00941     if (error.size()) {
00942         fprintf(stderr, "Error opening output file \"%s\".\n", outFileName);
00943         return false;
00944     }
00945 
00946     llvm::PassManager pm;
00947     if (const llvm::TargetData *td = targetMachine->getTargetData())
00948         pm.add(new llvm::TargetData(*td));
00949     else
00950         pm.add(new llvm::TargetData(module));
00951 
00952     llvm::formatted_raw_ostream fos(of->os());
00953     llvm::CodeGenOpt::Level optLevel = 
00954         (g->opt.level > 0) ? llvm::CodeGenOpt::Aggressive : llvm::CodeGenOpt::None;
00955 
00956     if (targetMachine->addPassesToEmitFile(pm, fos, fileType, optLevel)) {
00957         fprintf(stderr, "Fatal error adding passes to emit object file!");
00958         exit(1);
00959     }
00960 
00961     // Finally, run the passes to emit the object file/assembly
00962     pm.run(*module);
00963 
00964     // Success; tell tool_output_file to keep the final output file. 
00965     of->keep();
00966 
00967     return true;
00968 }
00969 
00970 
00971 /** Small structure used in representing dependency graphs of structures
00972     (i.e. given a StructType, which other structure types does it have as
00973     elements).
00974  */ 
00975 struct StructDAGNode {
00976     StructDAGNode()
00977         : visited(false) { }
00978 
00979     bool visited;
00980     std::vector<const StructType *> dependents;
00981 };
00982 
00983 
00984 /** Visit a node for the topological sort.
00985  */
00986 static void
00987 lVisitNode(const StructType *structType, 
00988            std::map<const StructType *, StructDAGNode *> &structToNode,
00989            std::vector<const StructType *> &sortedTypes) {
00990     assert(structToNode.find(structType) != structToNode.end());
00991     // Get the node that encodes the structs that this one is immediately
00992     // dependent on.
00993     StructDAGNode *node = structToNode[structType];
00994     if (node->visited)
00995         return;
00996 
00997     node->visited = true;
00998     // Depth-first traversal: visit all of the dependent nodes...
00999     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < node->dependents.size(); ++i)
01000         lVisitNode(node->dependents[i], structToNode, sortedTypes);
01001     // ...and then add this one to the sorted list
01002     sortedTypes.push_back(structType);
01003 }
01004            
01005 
01006 /** Given a set of structures that we want to print C declarations of in a
01007     header file, order them so that any struct that is used as a member
01008     variable in another struct is printed before the struct that uses it
01009     and then print them to the given file.
01010  */
01011 static void
01012 lEmitStructDecls(std::vector<const StructType *> &structTypes, FILE *file) {
01013     // First, build a DAG among the struct types where there is an edge
01014     // from node A to node B if struct type A depends on struct type B
01015 
01016     // Records the struct types that have incoming edges in the
01017     // DAG--i.e. the ones that one or more other struct types depend on
01018     std::set<const StructType *> hasIncomingEdges;
01019     // Records the mapping between struct type pointers and the
01020     // StructDagNode structures
01021     std::map<const StructType *, StructDAGNode *> structToNode;
01022     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < structTypes.size(); ++i) {
01023         // For each struct type, create its DAG node and record the
01024         // relationship between it and its node
01025         const StructType *st = structTypes[i];
01026         StructDAGNode *node = new StructDAGNode;
01027         structToNode[st] = node;
01028 
01029         for (int j = 0; j < st->GetElementCount(); ++j) {
01030             const StructType *elementStructType = 
01031                 dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(st->GetElementType(j));
01032             // If this element is a struct type and we haven't already
01033             // processed it for the current struct type, then upate th
01034             // dependencies and record that this element type has other
01035             // struct types that depend on it.
01036             if (elementStructType != NULL &&
01037                 (std::find(node->dependents.begin(), node->dependents.end(), 
01038                            elementStructType) == node->dependents.end())) {
01039                 node->dependents.push_back(elementStructType);
01040                 hasIncomingEdges.insert(elementStructType);
01041             }
01042         }
01043     }
01044 
01045     // Perform a topological sort of the struct types.  Kick it off by
01046     // visiting nodes with no incoming edges; i.e. the struct types that no
01047     // other struct types depend on.
01048     std::vector<const StructType *> sortedTypes;
01049     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < structTypes.size(); ++i) {
01050         const StructType *structType = structTypes[i];
01051         if (hasIncomingEdges.find(structType) == hasIncomingEdges.end())
01052             lVisitNode(structType, structToNode, sortedTypes);
01053     }
01054     assert(sortedTypes.size() == structTypes.size());
01055 
01056     // And finally we can emit the struct declarations by going through the
01057     // sorted ones in order.
01058     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < sortedTypes.size(); ++i) {
01059         const StructType *st = sortedTypes[i];
01060         fprintf(file, "struct %s {\n", st->GetStructName().c_str());
01061         for (int j = 0; j < st->GetElementCount(); ++j) {
01062             const Type *type = st->GetElementType(j)->GetAsNonConstType();
01063             std::string d = type->GetCDeclaration(st->GetElementName(j));
01064             fprintf(file, "    %s;\n", d.c_str());
01065         }
01066         fprintf(file, "};\n\n");
01067     }
01068 }
01069 
01070 
01071 /** Emit C declarations of enumerator types to the generated header file.
01072  */
01073 static void
01074 lEmitEnumDecls(const std::vector<const EnumType *> &enumTypes, FILE *file) {
01075     if (enumTypes.size() == 0)
01076         return;
01077 
01078     fprintf(file, "///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////\n");
01079     fprintf(file, "// Enumerator types with external visibility from ispc code\n");
01080     fprintf(file, "///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////\n\n");
01081     
01082     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < enumTypes.size(); ++i) {
01083         std::string declaration = enumTypes[i]->GetCDeclaration("");
01084         fprintf(file, "%s {\n", declaration.c_str());
01085 
01086         // Print the individual enumerators 
01087         for (int j = 0; j < enumTypes[i]->GetEnumeratorCount(); ++j) {
01088             const Symbol *e = enumTypes[i]->GetEnumerator(j);
01089             assert(e->constValue != NULL);
01090             unsigned int enumValue;
01091             int count = e->constValue->AsUInt32(&enumValue);
01092             assert(count == 1);
01093 
01094             // Always print an initializer to set the value.  We could be
01095             // 'clever' here and detect whether the implicit value given by
01096             // one plus the previous enumerator value (or zero, for the
01097             // first enumerator) is the same as the value stored with the
01098             // enumerator, though that doesn't seem worth the trouble...
01099             fprintf(file, "    %s = %d%c\n", e->name.c_str(), enumValue,
01100                     (j < enumTypes[i]->GetEnumeratorCount() - 1) ? ',' : ' ');
01101         }
01102         fprintf(file, "};\n");
01103     }
01104 }
01105 
01106 
01107 /** Print declarations of VectorTypes used in 'export'ed parts of the
01108     program in the header file.
01109  */
01110 static void
01111 lEmitVectorTypedefs(const std::vector<const VectorType *> &types, FILE *file) {
01112     if (types.size() == 0)
01113         return;
01114 
01115     fprintf(file, "///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////\n");
01116     fprintf(file, "// Vector types with external visibility from ispc code\n");
01117     fprintf(file, "///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////\n\n");
01118 
01119     int align = g->target.nativeVectorWidth * 4;
01120 
01121     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < types.size(); ++i) {
01122         std::string baseDecl;
01123         const VectorType *vt = types[i]->GetAsNonConstType();
01124         int size = vt->GetElementCount();
01125 
01126         baseDecl = vt->GetBaseType()->GetCDeclaration("");
01127         fprintf(file, "#ifdef _MSC_VER\n__declspec( align(%d) ) ", align);
01128         fprintf(file, "struct %s%d { %s v[%d]; };\n", baseDecl.c_str(), size,
01129                 baseDecl.c_str(), size);
01130         fprintf(file, "#else\n");
01131         fprintf(file, "struct %s%d { %s v[%d]; } __attribute__ ((aligned(%d)));\n", 
01132                 baseDecl.c_str(), size, baseDecl.c_str(), size, align);
01133         fprintf(file, "#endif\n");
01134     }
01135     fprintf(file, "\n");
01136 }
01137 
01138 
01139 /** Add the given type to the vector, if that type isn't already in there.
01140  */
01141 template <typename T> static void
01142 lAddTypeIfNew(const Type *type, std::vector<const T *> *exportedTypes) {
01143     type = type->GetAsNonConstType();
01144 
01145     // Linear search, so this ends up being n^2.  It's unlikely this will
01146     // matter in practice, though.
01147     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < exportedTypes->size(); ++i)
01148         if (Type::Equal((*exportedTypes)[i], type))
01149             return;
01150 
01151     const T *castType = dynamic_cast<const T *>(type);
01152     assert(castType != NULL);
01153     exportedTypes->push_back(castType);
01154 }
01155 
01156 
01157 /** Given an arbitrary type that appears in the app/ispc interface, add it
01158     to an appropriate vector if it is a struct, enum, or short vector type.
01159     Then, if it's a struct, recursively process its members to do the same.
01160  */
01161 static void
01162 lGetExportedTypes(const Type *type, 
01163                   std::vector<const StructType *> *exportedStructTypes,
01164                   std::vector<const EnumType *> *exportedEnumTypes,
01165                   std::vector<const VectorType *> *exportedVectorTypes) {
01166     const ArrayType *arrayType = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(type);
01167     const StructType *structType = dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(type);
01168 
01169     if (dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(type) != NULL)
01170         lGetExportedTypes(type->GetReferenceTarget(), exportedStructTypes, 
01171                           exportedEnumTypes, exportedVectorTypes);
01172     else if (arrayType != NULL)
01173         lGetExportedTypes(arrayType->GetElementType(), exportedStructTypes, 
01174                           exportedEnumTypes, exportedVectorTypes);
01175     else if (structType != NULL) {
01176         lAddTypeIfNew(type, exportedStructTypes);
01177         for (int i = 0; i < structType->GetElementCount(); ++i)
01178             lGetExportedTypes(structType->GetElementType(i), exportedStructTypes,
01179                               exportedEnumTypes, exportedVectorTypes);
01180     }
01181     else if (dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(type) != NULL)
01182         lAddTypeIfNew(type, exportedEnumTypes);
01183     else if (dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(type) != NULL)
01184         lAddTypeIfNew(type, exportedVectorTypes);
01185     else
01186         assert(dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(type) != NULL);
01187 }
01188 
01189 
01190 /** Given a set of functions, return the set of structure and vector types
01191     present in the parameters to them.
01192  */
01193 static void
01194 lGetExportedParamTypes(const std::vector<Symbol *> &funcs, 
01195                        std::vector<const StructType *> *exportedStructTypes,
01196                        std::vector<const EnumType *> *exportedEnumTypes,
01197                        std::vector<const VectorType *> *exportedVectorTypes) {
01198     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < funcs.size(); ++i) {
01199         const FunctionType *ftype = dynamic_cast<const FunctionType *>(funcs[i]->type);
01200         // Handle the return type
01201         lGetExportedTypes(ftype->GetReturnType(), exportedStructTypes,
01202                           exportedEnumTypes, exportedVectorTypes);
01203 
01204         // And now the parameter types...
01205         const std::vector<const Type *> &argTypes = ftype->GetArgumentTypes();
01206         for (unsigned int j = 0; j < argTypes.size(); ++j)
01207             lGetExportedTypes(argTypes[j], exportedStructTypes,
01208                               exportedEnumTypes, exportedVectorTypes);
01209     }
01210 }
01211 
01212 
01213 static void
01214 lPrintFunctionDeclarations(FILE *file, const std::vector<Symbol *> &funcs) {
01215     fprintf(file, "#ifdef __cplusplus\nextern \"C\" {\n#endif // __cplusplus\n");
01216     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < funcs.size(); ++i) {
01217         const FunctionType *ftype = dynamic_cast<const FunctionType *>(funcs[i]->type);
01218         assert(ftype);
01219         std::string decl = ftype->GetCDeclaration(funcs[i]->name);
01220         fprintf(file, "    extern %s;\n", decl.c_str());
01221     }
01222     fprintf(file, "#ifdef __cplusplus\n}\n#endif // __cplusplus\n");
01223 }
01224 
01225 
01226 static void
01227 lPrintExternGlobals(FILE *file, const std::vector<Symbol *> &externGlobals) {
01228     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < externGlobals.size(); ++i) {
01229         Symbol *sym = externGlobals[i];
01230         if (lRecursiveCheckVarying(sym->type))
01231             Warning(sym->pos, "Not emitting declaration for symbol \"%s\" into generated "
01232                     "header file since it (or some of its members) are varying.",
01233                     sym->name.c_str());
01234         else
01235             fprintf(file, "extern %s;\n", sym->type->GetCDeclaration(sym->name).c_str());
01236     }
01237 }
01238 
01239 
01240 static bool
01241 lIsExported(const Symbol *sym) {
01242     const FunctionType *ft = dynamic_cast<const FunctionType *>(sym->type);
01243     assert(ft);
01244     return ft->isExported;
01245 }
01246 
01247 
01248 static bool
01249 lIsExternC(const Symbol *sym) {
01250     const FunctionType *ft = dynamic_cast<const FunctionType *>(sym->type);
01251     assert(ft);
01252     return ft->isExternC;
01253 }
01254 
01255 
01256 bool
01257 Module::writeHeader(const char *fn) {
01258     FILE *f = fopen(fn, "w");
01259     if (!f) {
01260         perror("fopen");
01261         return false;
01262     }
01263     fprintf(f, "//\n// %s\n// (Header automatically generated by the ispc compiler.)\n", fn);
01264     fprintf(f, "// DO NOT EDIT THIS FILE.\n//\n\n");
01265 
01266     // Create a nice guard string from the filename, turning any
01267     // non-number/letter characters into underbars
01268     std::string guard = "ISPC_";
01269     const char *p = fn;
01270     while (*p) {
01271         if (isdigit(*p)) 
01272             guard += *p;
01273         else if (isalpha(*p)) 
01274             guard += toupper(*p);
01275         else
01276             guard += "_";
01277         ++p;
01278     }
01279     fprintf(f, "#ifndef %s\n#define %s\n\n", guard.c_str(), guard.c_str());
01280 
01281     fprintf(f, "#include <stdint.h>\n\n");
01282 
01283     switch (g->target.isa) {
01284     case Target::SSE2:
01285         fprintf(f, "#define ISPC_TARGET_SSE2\n\n");
01286         break;
01287     case Target::SSE4:
01288         fprintf(f, "#define ISPC_TARGET_SSE4\n\n");
01289         break;
01290     case Target::AVX:
01291         fprintf(f, "#define ISPC_TARGET_AVX\n\n");
01292         break;
01293     default:
01294         FATAL("Unhandled target in header emission");
01295     }
01296 
01297     fprintf(f, "#ifdef __cplusplus\nnamespace ispc {\n#endif // __cplusplus\n\n");
01298 
01299     if (g->emitInstrumentation) {
01300         fprintf(f, "#define ISPC_INSTRUMENTATION 1\n");
01301         fprintf(f, "extern \"C\" {\n");
01302         fprintf(f, "  void ISPCInstrument(const char *fn, const char *note, int line, int mask);\n");
01303         fprintf(f, "}\n");
01304     }
01305 
01306     // Collect single linear arrays of the exported and extern "C"
01307     // functions
01308     std::vector<Symbol *> exportedFuncs, externCFuncs;
01309     m->symbolTable->GetMatchingFunctions(lIsExported, &exportedFuncs);
01310     m->symbolTable->GetMatchingFunctions(lIsExternC, &externCFuncs);
01311     
01312     // Get all of the struct, vector, and enumerant types used as function
01313     // parameters.  These vectors may have repeats.
01314     std::vector<const StructType *> exportedStructTypes;
01315     std::vector<const EnumType *> exportedEnumTypes;
01316     std::vector<const VectorType *> exportedVectorTypes;
01317     lGetExportedParamTypes(exportedFuncs, &exportedStructTypes,
01318                            &exportedEnumTypes, &exportedVectorTypes);
01319     lGetExportedParamTypes(externCFuncs, &exportedStructTypes,
01320                            &exportedEnumTypes, &exportedVectorTypes);
01321 
01322     // And do the same for the 'extern' globals
01323     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < externGlobals.size(); ++i)
01324         lGetExportedTypes(externGlobals[i]->type, &exportedStructTypes,
01325                           &exportedEnumTypes, &exportedVectorTypes);
01326 
01327     // And print them
01328     lEmitVectorTypedefs(exportedVectorTypes, f);
01329     lEmitEnumDecls(exportedEnumTypes, f);
01330     lEmitStructDecls(exportedStructTypes, f);
01331 
01332     // emit function declarations for exported stuff...
01333     if (exportedFuncs.size() > 0) {
01334         fprintf(f, "\n");
01335         fprintf(f, "///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////\n");
01336         fprintf(f, "// Functions exported from ispc code\n");
01337         fprintf(f, "///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////\n");
01338         lPrintFunctionDeclarations(f, exportedFuncs);
01339     }
01340 #if 0
01341     if (externCFuncs.size() > 0) {
01342         fprintf(f, "\n");
01343         fprintf(f, "///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////\n");
01344         fprintf(f, "// External C functions used by ispc code\n");
01345         fprintf(f, "///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////\n");
01346         lPrintFunctionDeclarations(f, externCFuncs);
01347     }
01348 #endif
01349 
01350     // end namespace
01351     fprintf(f, "\n#ifdef __cplusplus\n}\n#endif // __cplusplus\n");
01352 
01353     // and only now emit externs for globals, outside of the ispc namespace
01354     if (externGlobals.size() > 0) {
01355         fprintf(f, "\n");
01356         fprintf(f, "///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////\n");
01357         fprintf(f, "// Globals declared \"extern\" from ispc code\n");
01358         fprintf(f, "///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////\n");
01359         lPrintExternGlobals(f, externGlobals);
01360     }
01361 
01362     // end guard
01363     fprintf(f, "\n#endif // %s\n", guard.c_str());
01364 
01365     fclose(f);
01366     return true;
01367 }
01368 
01369 
01370 void
01371 Module::execPreprocessor(const char* infilename, llvm::raw_string_ostream* ostream) const
01372 {
01373     clang::CompilerInstance inst;
01374     std::string error;
01375 
01376     inst.createFileManager();
01377     inst.createDiagnostics(0, NULL);
01378     clang::TargetOptions& options = inst.getTargetOpts();
01379 
01380     llvm::Triple triple(module->getTargetTriple());
01381     if (triple.getTriple().empty())
01382         triple.setTriple(llvm::sys::getHostTriple());
01383     
01384     options.Triple = triple.getTriple();
01385 
01386     clang::TargetInfo* target 
01387         = clang::TargetInfo::CreateTargetInfo(inst.getDiagnostics(), options);
01388 
01389     inst.setTarget(target);
01390     inst.createSourceManager(inst.getFileManager());
01391     inst.InitializeSourceManager(infilename);
01392 
01393     clang::PreprocessorOptions& opts = inst.getPreprocessorOpts();
01394 
01395     //Add defs for ISPC and PI
01396     opts.addMacroDef("ISPC");
01397     opts.addMacroDef("PI=3.1415926535");
01398 
01399     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < g->cppArgs.size(); ++i) {
01400         //Sanity Check, should really begin with -D
01401         if (g->cppArgs[i].substr(0,2) == "-D") {
01402             opts.addMacroDef(g->cppArgs[i].substr(2));
01403         }
01404     }    
01405     inst.createPreprocessor();
01406     clang::DoPrintPreprocessedInput(inst.getPreprocessor(),
01407                                     ostream, inst.getPreprocessorOutputOpts());
01408 }
